title: Why are AP Mages being turned into the only class that needs to recall late game?
body:
A Tank can get {{item:3083}} and be healthy as can be in a few seconds time.
A Fighter or Marksman can get Lifesteal (from items such as {{item:3812}}) and be full health as soon as they find a Jungle Camp to kill.
An AD Caster can get {{item:3508}} to replenish their mana while they auto attack said Jungle Camp.

So why are Mages losing Mana Regen *and* Spell Vamp, being forced to recall instead of staying with their team?

replies.body: Dude you can let something hit you a bunch and get back Mana. Seems fair.

It's a decent question. I'll look into what the expectation for this is on Monday.

Back when season 5 launched, a lot of mages, the majority of them in fact, had their mana regen and mana regen per level reduced by a significant amount, due to many AP items having adjustments made to mana regen. Now that mana regeneration is being removed from most, if not, all AP items, will every mage receive compensation buffs to their mana regen?

Not to mention blue mana pots were removed in season 6 preseason.

The mana regeneration champions in Preseason 5 were done to regulate everyone so you don't have mages who are more effective with mana regeneration based on stats.  The change that affected most champions was the switch from flat mana regeneration on items (I.E. +20 mana regen per 5) to mana regeneration based on that champion's current base mana regeneration (I.E. +100% base mana regen per 5).  This is the change that made mages a bit less strong early as mana regeneration from items was lower early (and the same, later).

If mana regeneration across mage champions was to be touched, I could only see mana regeneration per level changed.
